value.title: The White House moves to hold artificial intelligence accountable with AI Bill of Rights
value.excerpt: To address this ever-growing issue, the White House today released a Blueprint for an AI Bill of Rights. This outlines five principles that should guide the design, use and deployment of automated systems to protect Americans in this age of AI.

value.title: Tesla announces it’s moving away from ultrasonic sensors in favor of ‘Tesla Vision’
value.excerpt: Tesla announced today that it is moving away from using ultrasonic sensors in its suite of Autopilot sensors in favor of its camera-only “Tesla Vision” system. Last year, Tesla announced it would transition to its “Tesla Vision” Autopilot without radar and start producing vehicles without a front-facing radar.

value.title: Tesla unveils functional prototypes of its planned humanoid robot
value.excerpt: Elon Musk announced that Tesla was working on a bipedal humanoid robot that could perform boring and/or dangerous tasks for humans. His company has now unveiled two prototypes, one of which can already walk on its own.

value.title: Three Reasons Why Artificial Intelligence Wins With Specialization
value.excerpt: When I began learning about artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML), it was from the perspective of trying to help very smart people do challenging tasks. This is opposed to learning about an AI algorithm and trying to see how far I could push it for the sake of science (which has its own merits) and then searching for an application in the real world.

value.title: Intel’s self-driving company Mobileye files for an IPO
value.excerpt: Founded in 1999 by Amnon Shashua and Ziv Aviram, Mobileye is known for its EyeQ system-on-a-chip (SoC), which serves as the “brain” for Mobileye’s driver-assist and self-driving technology.
